title: How to Untag Yourself on Facebook Posts: Steps for Desktop and Mobile

steps.title: Open Facebook.
steps.content: Open Facebook. It's a dark-blue app with a white "f" on it. This will open your Facebook News Feed if you're already logged into Facebook on your phone or tablet. If you aren't logged into Facebook, enter your email address (or phone number) and password to continue.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . It's in either the bottom-right corner of the screen (iPhone) or the top-right corner of the screen (Android).

steps.title: Tap your name.
steps.content: Tap your name. You'll see this tab at the top of the menu. Doing so takes you to your profile page.

steps.title: Scroll down to find the post you want to untag.
steps.content: Scroll down to find the post you want to untag. This can be a photo, a status, or a check-in at a local location.

steps.title: Tap .
steps.content: Tap . It's in the upper-right corner of a post.

steps.title: Tap Remove tag.
steps.content: Tap Remove tag . This option is near the top of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap OK when prompted.
steps.content: Tap OK when prompted. Doing so removes your name from the post and removes the post from your Facebook page. Other people will still be able to see the post if they're friends with the person who posted it, or if the post is public.

steps.title: Go to Facebook's website.
steps.content: Go to Facebook's website. Go to https://www.facebook.com in your preferred browser. This will load your News Feed if you're already logged into Facebook. If you aren't already logged into Facebook, enter your email address (or phone number) and password before continuing.

steps.title: Click .
steps.content: Click . This icon is in the upper-right side of the Facebook page. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Activity Log.
steps.content: Click Activity Log . It's near the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Posts You're Tagged In.
steps.content: Click Posts You're Tagged In . This tab is in the upper-left side of the page. This tab may just say Posts You're Tagged... .

steps.title: Click the pencil icon next to a post you want to untag.
steps.content: Click the pencil icon next to a post you want to untag. Every post you've ever been tagged in appears on this page; click the pencil-shaped icon to the right of a post you want to untag. You may have to scroll down to find the post you want to remove the tag from.

steps.title: Click Report/Remove Tag.
steps.content: Click Report/Remove Tag . It's at the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Check the "It's spam" box, then click Continue.
steps.content: Check the "It's spam" box, then click Continue . This option ensures that you won't have to fill out additional information.

steps.title: Click Remove Tag.
steps.content: Click Remove Tag . It's in the middle of the page.

steps.title: Click Remove Tag when prompted.
steps.content: Click Remove Tag when prompted. This will remove the tag from the post, and the post will be removed from your Facebook page. Other people will still be able to see the photo if they're friends with the person who posted it, or if the photo is public.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . It's either in the bottom-right corner of the screen (iPhone) or in the top-right corner of the screen (Android).

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Settings.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Settings . It's near the bottom of the page. Skip this step on Android.

steps.title: Tap Account Settings.
steps.content: Tap Account Settings . This option will take you to your Account Settings page. On Android, you must first scroll down.

steps.title: Tap Timeline and Tagging.
steps.content: Tap Timeline and Tagging . It's near the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the Review posts friends tag you in… option.
steps.content: Tap the Review posts friends tag you in… option. This option is in the "WHO CAN ADD THINGS TO MY TIMELINE?" group of options near the top of the page.

steps.title: Slide the "Timeline Review" right.
steps.content: Slide the "Timeline Review" right. It will switch to the right . Now you will need to review tagged posts before they can appear on your Facebook page. Tagged posts will still be viewable by friends of the original poster.

steps.title: Click .
steps.content: Click . This icon is in the upper-right side of the Facebook page. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's near the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Timeline and Tagging.
steps.content: Click Timeline and Tagging . You'll find this tab on the left side of the page.

steps.title: Edit the "Who can add things to my Timeline?" section.
steps.content: Edit the "Who can add things to my Timeline?" section. Click Edit to the right of the "Review posts friends tag you in before they appear on your Timeline?" option that's near the top of the page.

steps.title: Click the drop-down box.
steps.content: Click the drop-down box. It's in the middle of the expanded page; this box will most likely say Disabled . If the box says Enabled , your review settings are already enabled.

steps.title: Click Enabled.
steps.content: Click Enabled . This ensures that you will be able to review every post people tag you in before it gets posted to your Facebook page. Tagged posts will still be viewable by friends of the original poster.
